stimulusHtml: Let g be a function such that g(-1) = 0 and g(2) = 5. Which of the following conditions guarantees that there is an x, -1< x < 2, for which g(x) = 3 ?
choicesHtml: g is defined for all x in (-1, 2).
g is continuous for all x in [-1, 2 ].
There exists an x in (-1, 2) such that g'(x) = 5.

∫ −1 2 g ( x )dx=3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4242@
